page.title: 07Sand quarry, Fairfield
page.content: At thye sand quarry the sand is not hard. There are different kinds of sands. One is called red sand, blinding sand is white with stones in. There is big machinery to scoop the sand out with. When they have had the sand put in the lorry they go up to the weighbridge and weigh their lorries. If there is not enough in them they go and get some more. The cliff was about 70 feet high. On the pond there were two Canadian Geese with their goslings. At the sand quarry there are foxes, rabbits, grass snakes and many butterflies and birds. The red sand is used for making moulds at iron foundries, the building sand is used for making cement.
